intro: Cuphea retroscabra, commonly known as the backward cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Cuphea retroscabra is often grown as an ornamental plant for its vibrant floral display and ecological benefits.
